intro: Sphaeralcea speciosa, commonly known as the showy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert and chaparral environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are usually hairy. Sphaeralcea speciosa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
